DocumentReference.yaml.description:
A reference to a document.
    
    A reference to a document of any kind for any purpose. Provides metadata
    about the document so that the document can be discovered and managed. The
    scope of a document is any seralized object with a mime-type, so includes
    formal patient centric documents (CDA), cliical notes, scanned paper, and
    non-patient specific documents like policy text.

author.description: Who and/or what authored the document.

date.description: When this document reference was created.

docStatus.description: The status of the underlying document.. http://hl7.org/fhir/composition-status

term.description: The status of the underlying document.. http://hl7.org/fhir/composition-status

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

status.description: The status of this document reference.. http://hl7.org/fhir/document-reference-status

term.description: The status of this document reference.. http://hl7.org/fhir/document-reference-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

DocumentReference.yaml.title: DocumentReference

Observation.yaml.description:
Measurements and simple assertions.
    
    Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other
    subject.

category.description: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/observation-category

term.description: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/observation-category

dataAbsentReason.description: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/data-absent-reason unknown|asked-unknown|temp-unknown|not-asked|asked-declined|masked|not-applicable|unsupported|as-text|error|not-a-number|negative-infinity|positive-infinity|not-performed|not-permitted

term.description: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/data-absent-reason unknown|asked-unknown|temp-unknown|not-asked|asked-declined|masked|not-applicable|unsupported|as-text|error|not-a-number|negative-infinity|positive-infinity|not-performed|not-permitted

derivedFrom.description: Related measurements the observation is made from.

hasMember.description: Related resource that belongs to the Observation group.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

issued.description: Date/Time this version was made available.

performer.description: Who is responsible for the observation.

status.description: The status of the result value.. http://hl7.org/fhir/observation-status

term.description: The status of the result value.. http://hl7.org/fhir/observation-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

Observation.yaml.title: Observation

Patient.yaml.description:
Information about an individual or animal receiving health care services.
    
    Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or
    animal receiving care or other health-related services.

active.description: Whether this patient's record is in active use.

birthDate.description: The date of birth for the individual.

communication.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.

contact.description: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient.

deceasedBoolean.description: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

deceasedDateTime.description: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

gender.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.. http://hl7.org/fhir/administrative-gender

term.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.. http://hl7.org/fhir/administrative-gender

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

link.description: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual person.

multipleBirthBoolean.description: Whether patient is part of a multiple birth.

multipleBirthInteger.description: Whether patient is part of a multiple birth.

name.description: A name associated with the patient.

telecom.description: A contact detail for the individual.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

Patient.yaml.title: Patient

Practitioner.yaml.description:
A person with a  formal responsibility in the provisioning of healthcare or
    related services.
    
    A person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of
    healthcare.

active.description: Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.

address.description: Address(es) of the practitioner that are not role specific (typically home address).

birthDate.description: The date  on which the practitioner was born.

communication.description: A language the practitioner can use in patient communication.

gender.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.. http://hl7.org/fhir/administrative-gender

term.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.. http://hl7.org/fhir/administrative-gender

identifier.description: An identifier for the person as this agent.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

name.description: The name(s) associated with the practitioner.

qualification.description: Certification, licenses, or training pertaining to the provision of care.

telecom.description: A contact detail for the practitioner (that apply to all roles).

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

Practitioner.yaml.title: Practitioner

MedicationRequest.yaml.description:
Ordering of medication for patient or group.
    
    An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions
    for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called
    "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or
    "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient
    settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow
    patterns.

category.description: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-category inpatient|outpatient|community|discharge

term.description: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-category inpatient|outpatient|community|discharge

courseOfTherapyType.description: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-course-of-therapy continuous|acute|seasonal

term.description: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-course-of-therapy continuous|acute|seasonal

doNotPerform.description: True if request is prohibiting action.

dosageInstruction.description: How the medication should be taken.

eventHistory.description: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle.

groupIdentifier.description: Composite request this is part of.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

intent.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-intent

term.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-intent

performerType.description: Desired kind of performer of the medication administration.

priorPrescription.description: An order/prescription that is being replaced.

priority.description: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.. http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority

term.description: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.. http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority

reasonCode.description: Reason or indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

reasonReference.description: Condition or observation that supports why the prescription is being written.

status.description: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally, this will be active or completed state.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-status

term.description: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally, this will be active or completed state.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-status

statusReason.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-status-reason altchoice|clarif|drughigh|hospadm|labint|non-avail|preg|salg|sddi|sdupther|sintol|surg|washout

term.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-status-reason altchoice|clarif|drughigh|hospadm|labint|non-avail|preg|salg|sddi|sdupther|sintol|surg|washout

supportingInformation.description: Information to support ordering of the medication.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

MedicationRequest.yaml.title: MedicationRequest

_program.yaml.title: Program
_program.yaml.description: A broad framework of goals to be achieved. (NCIt C52647)

dbgap_accession_number.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the program.

_project.yaml.title: Project
_project.yaml.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

name.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

investigator_name.description: Name of the principal investigator for the project.

investigator_affiliation.description: The investigator's affiliation with respect to a research institution.

date_collected.description: The date or date range in which the project data was collected.

availability_type.description: Is the project open or restricted?

availability_mechanism.description: Mechanism by which the project will be made avilable.

support_source.description: The name of source providing support/grant resources.

support_id.description: The ID of the source providing support/grant resources.

programs.description: Indicates that the project is logically part of the indicated project.

state.description:
The possible states a project can be in.  All but `open` are
equivalent to some type of locked state.

released.description:
To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted
entities in the next GDC index.

releasable.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

intended_release_date.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

dbgap_accession_number.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

object_id.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

workflow_link.description: Link to Github hash for the CWL workflow used.

workflow_version.description: Major version for a GDC workflow.

submitter_id.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.

DiagnosticReport.yaml.description:
A Diagnostic report - a combination of request information, atomic results,
    images, interpretation, as well as formatted reports.
    
    The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients,
    groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from
    these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider
    information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded
    interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

conclusionCode.description: Codes for the clinical conclusion of test results.

imagingStudy.description: Reference to full details of imaging associated with the diagnostic report.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

media.description: Key images associated with this report.

specimen.description: Specimens this report is based on.

status.description: The status of the diagnostic report.. http://hl7.org/fhir/diagnostic-report-status

term.description: The status of the diagnostic report.. http://hl7.org/fhir/diagnostic-report-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

DiagnosticReport.yaml.title: DiagnosticReport

code.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/task-code approve|fulfill|abort|replace|change|suspend|resume

term.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/task-code approve|fulfill|abort|replace|change|suspend|resume

encounter.description: Healthcare event during which this task originated.

executionPeriod.description: Start and end time of execution.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

intent.description: unknown | proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option.

priority.description: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests.. http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority

term.description: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests.. http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority

relevantHistory.description: Key events in history of the Task.

requester.description: Who is asking for task to be done.

status.description: The current status of the task.. http://hl7.org/fhir/task-status

term.description: The current status of the task.. http://hl7.org/fhir/task-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

Condition.yaml.description:
Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses.
    
    A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue,
    or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

category.description: A category assigned to the condition.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-category problem-list-item|encounter-diagnosis

term.description: A category assigned to the condition.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-category problem-list-item|encounter-diagnosis

clinicalStatus.description: The clinical status of the condition.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-clinical

term.description: The clinical status of the condition.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-clinical

code.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

onsetAge.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age.

onsetDateTime.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age.

onsetPeriod.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age.

onsetRange.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age.

onsetString.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

verificationStatus.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-ver-status

term.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-ver-status

Condition.yaml.title: Condition

Location.yaml.description:
Details and position information for a physical place.
    
    Details and position information for a physical place where services are
    provided and resources and participants may be stored, found, contained, or
    accommodated.

alias.description: A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as, in the past.

description.description: Additional details about the location that could be displayed as further information to identify the location beyond its name.

endpoint.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location.

hoursOfOperation.description: What days/times during a week is this location usually open.

identifier.description: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

mode.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.. http://hl7.org/fhir/location-mode

term.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.. http://hl7.org/fhir/location-mode

name.description: Name of the location as used by humans.

operationalStatus.description: The operational status of the location (typically only for a bed/room).

partOf.description: Another Location this one is physically a part of.

physicalType.description: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/location-physical-type si|bu|wi|wa|lvl|co|ro|bd|ve|ho|ca|rd|area|jdn

term.description: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/location-physical-type si|bu|wi|wa|lvl|co|ro|bd|ve|ho|ca|rd|area|jdn

status.description: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location.. http://hl7.org/fhir/location-status

term.description: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location.. http://hl7.org/fhir/location-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

Location.yaml.title: Location

Encounter.yaml.description:
An interaction during which services are provided to the patient.
    
    An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose
    of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a
    patient.

account.description: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

appointment.description: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

basedOn.description: The ServiceRequest that initiated this encounter.

diagnosis.description: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

episodeOfCare.description: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against.

hospitalization.description: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

identifier.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

length.description: Quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent).

location.description: List of locations where the patient has been.

partOf.description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of.

participant.description: List of participants involved in the encounter.

period.description: The start and end time of the encounter.

priority.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

reasonCode.description: Coded reason the encounter takes place.

serviceProvider.description: The organization (facility) responsible for this encounter.

term.description: None. http://hl7.org/fhir/encounter-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

type.description: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/encounter-type ADMS|BD/BM-clin|CCS60|OKI

term.description: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/encounter-type ADMS|BD/BM-clin|CCS60|OKI

Encounter.yaml.title: Encounter

Procedure.yaml.description:
An action that is being or was performed on a patient.
    
    An action that is or was performed on or for a patient. This can be a
    physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like long term
    services, counseling, or hypnotherapy.

complicationDetail.description: A condition that is a result of the procedure.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

performer.description: The people who performed the procedure.

reasonReference.description: The justification that the procedure was performed.

report.description: Any report resulting from the procedure.

status.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally, this will be the in-progress or completed state.. http://hl7.org/fhir/event-status

term.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally, this will be the in-progress or completed state.. http://hl7.org/fhir/event-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

usedCode.description: Coded items used during the procedure.

Procedure.yaml.title: Procedure

Organization.yaml.description:
A grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose.
    
    A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations
    formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action.
    Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community
    groups, healthcare practice groups, payer/insurer, etc.

active.description: Whether the organization's record is still in active use.

alias.description: A list of alternate names that the organization is known as, or was known as in the past.

contact.description: Contact for the organization for a certain purpose.

endpoint.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the organization.

identifier.description: Identifies this organization  across multiple systems.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

telecom.description: A contact detail for the organization.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

type.description: The kind(s) of organization that this is.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/organization-type prov|dept|team|govt|ins|pay|edu|reli|crs|cg|bus|other

term.description: The kind(s) of organization that this is.. http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/organization-type prov|dept|team|govt|ins|pay|edu|reli|crs|cg|bus|other

Organization.yaml.title: Organization

data_category.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

data_file_error_type.description: Type of error for the data file object.

data_type.description: Specific content type of the data file. (CMG)

datetime.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

encoding.description: Version of ASCII encoding of quality values found in the file.

file_format.description: The format of the data file object.

file_name.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

file_size.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

file_state.description: The current state of the data file object.

md5sum.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

project_id.description: Unique ID for any specific defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement.

state.description: The current state of the object.

UUID.description: A 128-bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

microsatellite_instability_abnormal.description: The yes/no indicator to signify the status of a tumor for microsatellite instability.

morphology.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

termDef.term: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition ICD-O-3 Histology Code

new_event_anatomic_site.description: Text term to specify the anatomic location of the return of tumor after treatment.

termDef.term: New Neoplasm Event Occurrence Anatomic Site

new_event_type.description: Text term to identify a new tumor event.

normal_tumor_genotype_snp_match.description: Text term that represents whether or not the genotype of the normal tumor matches or if the data is not available.

number_proliferating_cells.description: Numeric value that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the sample slide(s).

termDef.term: Pathology Review Slide Proliferating Cell Count

oct_embedded.description: Indicator of whether or not the sample was embedded in Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) compound.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound Embedding Indicator

years_smoked.description: Numeric value (or unknown) to represent the number of years a person has been smoking (HARMONIZED). If the number of years is greater than 89, see 'years_smoked_gt89'.

percent_eosinophil_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by eosinophils in a tumor sample or specimen.

percent_gc_content.description: The overall %GC of all bases in all sequences.

percent_granulocyte_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by granulocytes in a tumor sample or specimen.

percent_inflam_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by reddness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

percent_lymphocyte_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by lymphocytes in a solid tissue normal sample or specimen.

percent_monocyte_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of monocyte infiltration in a sample or specimen.

percent_necrosis.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumor sample or specimen.

percent_neutrophil_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by neutrophils in a tumor sample or specimen.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Neutrophil Infiltration Percentage Cell Value

percent_normal_cells.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of normal cell content in a malignant tumor sample or specimen.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Normal Cell Percentage Value

percent_stromal_cells.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumor sample or specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Stromal Cell Percentage Value

percent_tumor_cells.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of infiltration by granulocytes in a sample.

percent_tumor_nuclei.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of tumor nuclei in a malignant neoplasm sample or specimen.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Neoplasm Nucleus Percentage Cell Value

perineural_invasion_present.description: a yes/no indicator to ask if perineural invasion or infiltration of tumor or cancer is present.

platform.description: Name of the platform used to obtain data.

portion_number.description: Numeric value that represents the sequential number assigned to a portion of the sample.

portion_weight.description: Numeric value that represents the sample portion weight, measured in milligrams.

preservation_method.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

prior_malignancy.description: Text term to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis and the spatial location of any previous cancer occurrence.

termDef.term: Prior Cancer Diagnosis Occurrence Description Text

prior_treatment.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

termDef.term: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Specimen Collection Administered Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator

progesterone_receptor_percent_positive_i.description: Classification to represent Progesterone Receptor Positive results expressed as a percentage value.

termDef.term: Progesterone Receptor Level Cell Percentage Category

progesterone_receptor_result_ihc.description: Text term to represent the overall result of Progresterone Receptor (PR) testing.

progression_or_recurrence.description: Yes/No/Unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.

termDef.term: New Neoplasm Event Post Initial Therapy Indicator

qc_metric_state.description: State classification given by FASTQC for the metric. Metric specific details about the states are available on their website.

race.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species (HARMONIZED). It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau. (GTEx)

read_group_name.description: The name of the read group.

relationship_age_at_diagnosis.description: The age (in years) when the patient's relative was first diagnosed.

relationship_to_proband.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.

relationship_type.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.

relative_with_cancer_history.description: Indicator to signify whether or not an individual's biological relative has been diagnosed with another type of cancer.

termDef.term: Other Cancer Biological Relative History Indicator

residual_disease.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.

RIN.description: A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample including the presence or absence of degradation products.

sample_type.description: Text term to describe the source of a biospecimen used for a laboratory test.

sample_type_id.description: The accompanying sample type id for the sample type.

sequencing_center.description: Name of the center that provided the sequence files.

shortest_dimension.description: Numeric value that represents the shortest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Short Dimension Millimeter Measurement

site_of_resection_or_biopsy.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The description of an anatomical region or of a body part. Named locations of, or within, the body. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

termDef.term: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition ICD-O-3 Site Code

smoking_history.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.

smoking_intensity.description: Numeric computed value to represent lifetime tobacco exposure defined as number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked divided by 20

termDef.term: Person Cigarette Smoking History Pack Year Value

source_center.description: Name of the center that provided the item.

spectrophotometer_method.description: Name of the method used to determine the concentration of purified nucleic acid within a solution.

termDef.term: Purification Nucleic Acid Solution Concentration Determination Method Type

spike_ins_fasta.description: Name of the FASTA file that contains the spike-in sequences.

therapeutic_agents.description: Text identification of the individual agent(s) used as part of a prior treatment regimen.

time_between_clamping_and_freezing.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the surgical clamping of blood supply and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Clamping and Freezing Elapsed Minute Time

time_between_excision_and_freezing.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the excision and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Excision and Freezing Elapsed Minute Time

tissue_or_organ_of_origin.description: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the tumor or disease.

tissue_type.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

to_trim_adapter_sequence.description: Does the user suggest adapter trimming?

tobacco_smoking_onset_year.description: The year in which the participant began smoking.

tobacco_smoking_quit_year.description: The year in which the participant quit smoking.

tobacco_smoking_status.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.

total_sequences.description: A count of the total number of sequences processed.

treatment_anatomic_site.description: The anatomic site or field targeted by a treatment regimen or single agent therapy.

treatment_intent_type.description: Text term to identify the reason for the administration of a treatment regimen. [Manually-curated]

treatment_or_therapy.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

termDef.term: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Specimen Collection Administered Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator

treatment_outcome.description: Text term that describes the patient¿s final outcome after the treatment was administered.

treatment_type.description: Text term that describes the kind of treatment administered.

tumor_grade.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.

tumor_code.description: Diagnostic tumor code of the tissue sample source.

tumor_code_id.description: BCR-defined id code for the tumor sample.

tumor_descriptor.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

tumor_stage.description: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. The accepted values for tumor_stage depend on the tumor site, type, and accepted staging system. These items should accompany the tumor_stage value as associated metadata.

vascular_invasion_present.description: The yes/no indicator to ask if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen.

vital_status.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

weight.description: The weight of the patient measured in lbs (HARMONIZED).

well_number.description: Numeric value that represents the the well location within a plate for the analyte or aliquot from the sample.

termDef.term: Biospecimen Analyte or Aliquot Plate Well Number

workflow_type.description: Generic name for the workflow used to analyze a data set.

year_of_birth.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.

year_of_diagnosis.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual's initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer.

year_of_death.description: Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.

years_smoked_gt89.description: Indicate whether the numeric value to represent the number of years a person has been smoking (HARMONIZED) is greater than 89 years.

ga4gh_drs_uri.description: DRS URI as defined by GA4GH DRS spec for pointers to file objects.

ImagingStudy.yaml.description:
A set of images produced in single study (one or more series of references
    images).
    
    Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study
    comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object
    Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced
    in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR,
    ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

modality.description: All series modality if actual acquisition modalities.

series.description: Each study has one or more series of instances.

status.description: The current state of the ImagingStudy.. http://hl7.org/fhir/imagingstudy-status

term.description: The current state of the ImagingStudy.. http://hl7.org/fhir/imagingstudy-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

ImagingStudy.yaml.title: ImagingStudy

ResearchStudy.yaml.description:
Investigation to increase healthcare-related patient-independent knowledge.
    
    A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a
    series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related
    knowledge.  This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative
    effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies
    and other interventional and investigative techniques.  A ResearchStudy
    involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects.

arm.description: Defined path through the study for a subject.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

period.description: When the study began and ended.

site.description: Facility where study activities are conducted.

status.description: The current state of the study.. http://hl7.org/fhir/research-study-status

term.description: The current state of the study.. http://hl7.org/fhir/research-study-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

ResearchStudy.yaml.title: ResearchStudy

Specimen.yaml.description:
Sample for analysis.
    
    A sample to be used for analysis.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

parent.description: Specimen from which this specimen originated.

receivedTime.description: The time when specimen was received for processing.

status.description: The availability of the specimen.. http://hl7.org/fhir/specimen-status

term.description: The availability of the specimen.. http://hl7.org/fhir/specimen-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

type.description: Kind of material that forms the specimen.

Specimen.yaml.title: Specimen

Medication.yaml.description:
Definition of a Medication.
    
    This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a
    medication for the purposes of prescribing, dispensing, and administering a
    medication as well as for making statements about medication use.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

status.description: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medication-status

term.description: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.. http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medication-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

Medication.yaml.title: Medication

ResearchSubject.yaml.description:
Physical entity which is the primary unit of interest in the study.
    
    A physical entity which is the primary unit of operational and/or
    administrative interest in a study.

identifier.description: Business Identifier for research subject in a study.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created.

status.description: The current state of the subject.. http://hl7.org/fhir/research-subject-status

term.description: The current state of the subject.. http://hl7.org/fhir/research-subject-status

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.

ResearchSubject.yaml.title: ResearchSubject

identifier.description: An identifier for the person as this agent.

core_metadata_collection.yaml.title: Core Metadata Collection
core_metadata_collection.yaml.description: A collection of data files in a project.

contributor.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Contributor should be used to indicate the entity.

coverage.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant. Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN] (http-//www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabulary/tgn/index.html). Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

creator.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource. Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.

data_type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMITYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the Format element.

date.description: The date the collection of data was created.

description.description: An account of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to- an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

format.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource. Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the list of Internet Media Types [MIME] (http-//www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/).

language.description: A language of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 (http-//www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4646.txt).

publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

relation.description: A related resource. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

rights.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights.

source.description: A related resource from which the described resource is derived. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

subject.description: The topic of the resource. Typically, the subject will be represented using keywords, key phrases, or classification codes. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

title.description: A name given to the resource. Typically, a Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.

projects.description: The project code for the record in the project node that this core_metadata_collection belongs to, i.e., a link to the parent node.
